stringParam.name: text_expression
stringParam.help: Enter the word or phrase that you wish to query. Use an asterisk as a wildcard to match partial words. Use quotation marks around multiple words to match the exact phrase.

flatVocabParam.name: text_fields
flatVocabParam.help: Choose which text fields to search.

stringParam.name: keyword
stringParam.help: You can use boolean terms in search keyword.

flatVocabParam.name: pfam_id_type_ahead
flatVocabParam.help: Start typing and then choose a domain from the list. As you type the list narrows to the entries that match what you have typed.

flatVocabParam.name: ec_number_type_ahead
flatVocabParam.help: Enzyme Commission numbers describe enzymes hierarchically by the class of reactions they catalyze. Begin typing an EC number or name to see a list of all possible EC categories that match what you have typed. Then choose an EC category from the list. Use '-' as a wildcard in place of numbers to denote partial EC Numbers.

flatVocabParam.name: organism
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one or more organisms to search with the given motif

sqlQuery.name: AllOrganisms
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT t.name AS display, t.three_letter_abbrev AS term, t.three_letter_abbrev AS internal, (SELECT three_letter_abbrev FROM apidb.OrthomclTaxon p WHERE p.orthomcl_taxon_id = t.parent_id) AS parentTerm FROM apidb.OrthomclTaxon t

sqlQuery.name: PfamTypeAhead
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct accession AS internal, accession AS term, accession || ' ' ||description AS display, description FROM ApidbTuning.DomainAssignment ORDER BY lower(description)

sqlQuery.name: EcNumberTypeAhead
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT ec2.ec_number AS internal, ec2.ec_number AS term, ec2.ec_number || ' (' || ec2.description || ')' AS display FROM (select distinct ec.ec_number, ec.description from dots.aaSequenceEnzymeClass asec, sres.enzymeClass ec where asec.enzyme_class_id = ec.enzyme_class_id) ec2 UNION SELECT 'N/A' AS internal, 'N/A' AS term, 'N/A' AS display FROM dual

group.name: corePeripheralAdvancedParams
group.description: ![CDATA[OrthoMCL contains two sets of genomes. A Core set of 150 genomes have been chosen as well annotated reference organisms that broadly represent the major branches of the tree of life. All of the additional non-core VEuPathDB organisms (pathogens, hosts, and vectors) are called Peripheral organisms, in some cases including multiple strains and genome assemblies for the same species. The search ranges below can be used to filter the number of proteins {taxa} in each orthogroup by the number of Core and Peripheral (minimum and maximum) in each group. The number of Core and Peripheral will sum to the number of all proteins {taxa} in the group.]]
